name: growly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Someone who has a growly voice makes long, low, rough sounds that are similar to the threatening sound made by an angry dog: He started to sing in a growly voice. She is known for her growly, gravelly voice.
A growly animal or person makes a low, rough sound, usually in anger: How safe is the neighbours' growly dog? They were as surly, growly, and rude as an audience can be. Related word
growl
More examplesFewer examplesIn an instant, his expansive wit and warm growly voice were gone.She has a deeper, growlier voice than he does.This particular song was well suited to her growly, feisty voice.His growly baritone is full of heartbreak.She affects a growly Southern-dowager accent. Her voice - gutsy and growly - still sounds great.The dog was growly and aggressive whenever anyone came near.
